content: Appeals and Grievances - is anyone using FHIR Resources to represent this work? If so, what are you using in the way of Resources.

If useful - one example would be to support this Medicare process, https://www.cms.gov/Medicare/Appeals-and-Grievances/MMCAG/Downloads/Parts-C-and-D-Enrollee-Grievances-Organization-Coverage-Determinations-and-Appeals-Guidance.pdf

So I hear Communication Request might be used for Appeals. Mary Kay McDaniel, Financial Management co-chair, will be setting up a meeting to discuss further. I wanted to post here because from what I see both Communication Request and Service Request seem to be more clinical than administrative. Are we off on the right foot or not?

CommunicationRequest is not appropriate for this. We need to remember that everything in FHIR is communication. CommunicationRequest is about authorizing the sharing of data from one individual to another.
It's not a vehicle for "I need to say X, so I'll just wrap it in a CommunicationRequest because I'm communicating"
Who can we invite to this group that could help us conceptually with what we should use or if we need a new resource like FinancialCommunicationRequest - Iknow too long of a name :)
I'm not sure you need a new resource. This seems like "please initiate process XYZ" situation which would generally be handled using Task. (It's the general purpose 'please do' resource.)
